blogPost.title: Activists are campaigning for stronger laws to punish the perpetrators of violence against women and to ensure survivors can get help. But the biggest challenge is preventing violence in the first place https://t.co/VrpPamtH2m
blogPost.author: The Economist

localize.full_text: 活动家们正在开展运动，争取制定更强有力的法律，以惩罚暴力侵害妇女的肇事者，并确保幸存者能够得到帮助。但最大的挑战是如何从一开始就预防暴力https://t.co/VrpPamtH2m。
活動家們正在開展運動，爭取制定更強有力的法律，以懲罰暴力侵害婦女的肇事者，並確保倖存者能夠得到幫助。但最大的挑戰是如何從一開始就預防暴力https://t.co/VrpPamtH2m。

previous.title: As usual, Nordic countries performed best overall in the latest glass-ceiling index from The Economist, with Sweden, Iceland, Finland and Norway taking the top four spots #IWD2021 https://t.co/gjWBBc49hL

localize.full_text: 一如既往，北欧国家在《经济学人》最新的玻璃天花板指数中整体表现最佳，瑞典、冰岛、芬兰和挪威占据了前四名#IWD2021 https://t.co/gjWBBc49hL。
一如既往，北歐國家在《經濟學人》最新的玻璃天花板指數中整體表現最佳，瑞典、冰島、芬蘭和挪威佔據了前四名#IWD2021 https://t.co/gjWBBc49hL。

next.title: Women in sub-Saharan Africa who attended school are more likely to experience violence than those with no education. The same goes for women who work  https://t.co/WO6ZyeWtUt

localize.full_text: 在撒哈拉以南非洲，上学的妇女比没有受过教育的妇女更可能遭受暴力。工作的妇女也是如此，https://t.co/WO6ZyeWtUt
在撒哈拉以南非洲，上學的婦女比沒有受過教育的婦女更可能遭受暴力。工作的婦女也是如此，https://t.co/WO6ZyeWtUt
